    • Method Detail

      • getCategoryTree

        AdminCategory[] getCategoryTree(int languageId,
                                boolean getNumProducts)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns an array of top level categories each of which includes an array of child categories etc. so that the category tree structure can be navigated.

        Each Category class contains a field that describes how many products exist for that category. This field is calculated if getNumProducts is set to true.

        Parameters:
        languageId - the languageId
        getNumProducts - the getNumProducts
        Returns:
        Array of Category Objects
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception

      • getCategoryTreeFlattenedList

        AdminCategory[] getCategoryTreeFlattenedList(AdminCategory[] catTree)
        Creates an array of all categories from the Category Tree specified. Rather than just having the top level categories (with their children, and their children's children) as elements it flattens the tree structure to show all categories.
        Parameters:
        catTree - the catTree
        Returns:
        Array of all Category Objects

      • getAllCategories

        AdminCategory[] getAllCategories(int languageId)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns an array of all categories sparsely-populated with Id and name (in the specified language) only.

        Returns:

      • getTopLevelCategories

        AdminCategory[] getTopLevelCategories(int languageId,
                                      AdminDataDescriptor dataDesc)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns all of the top level categories which are those that have a parentId = 0. An AdminDataDescriptor object may be supplied in order to add constraints and control the number of categories returned.
        Parameters:
        languageId - the languageId
        dataDesc - the dataDesc
        Returns:
        Array of Category Objects
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception

      • getChildren

        int[] getChildren(int categoryId)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns an array of categoryId describing the children of the given category. Returns null if there are no children.
        Parameters:
        categoryId - the categoryId
        Returns:
        Return an array of categoryId
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception

      • getCategory

        AdminCategory getCategory(int categoryId,
                          boolean getChildren,
                          int languageId)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        categoryId - the categoryId
        getChildren - If true we get all of the children. Children don't have an array of descriptions.
        languageId - Needed to determine the language Id of the children
        Returns:
        Return a fully populated single category object (no children) or null if the category does not exist
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception

      • getCategoryFromCache

        AdminCategory getCategoryFromCache(int catId,
                                   int languageId)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        It returns the category from a hash map created when building the category tree. The category contains the children. It's not a clone and so shouldn't be modified.
        Parameters:
        catId - the catId
        languageId - the languageId
        Returns:
        Returns an Admin category object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception

      • getCategoryTreeFromCache

                                  throws java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:
        languageId - the languageId
        Returns:
        Returns the category tree

      • deleteCategoryTree

        void deleteCategoryTree(int categoryId,
                        int options)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Delete the category referenced to by categoryId. The child categories and products will either be moved up a level or deleted. If the category is a top level category, then the products will be deleted.
        Parameters:
        categoryId - the categoryId
        options - the options
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception

      • getCategoriesPerTagGroup

        int[] getCategoriesPerTagGroup(int tagGroupId)
                        throws java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:
        tagGroupId - The Id of the tag Group
        Returns:
        Returns an array of Category Ids
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception
